guiFX

Class FlowBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • guiFX.FlowBuffer

  • public class FlowBuffer
extends java.lang.Object
    The FlowBuffer class will hold a master list of packets we have seen in the network, as reported from the DPSS service in the C backend

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) static ConnectionList connections 
      private static java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> synchronizedMap

      static void addToBuffer(int ID, java.util.List<java.lang.String> value)
      This method will add a packet to the FlowBuffer, when we see it leave a router
      static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> checkLoss()
      This method will check the loss of objects in the FlowBuffer **UNUSED at the moment
      static void getItem()
      This method will walk through the FlowBuffer and print out the current FlowBuffer contents

      This method checks the size of the FlowBuffer

      This method will print the buffer to the console in string format

    • Method Detail

      • addToBuffer

        public static void addToBuffer(int ID,
               java.util.List<java.lang.String> value)
        This method will add a packet to the FlowBuffer, when we see it leave a router
        Parameters:
        ID - - unique ID number of the packet
        value - - List {Router hostname, Router interface name}

      • removeFrombuffer

        public static void removeFrombuffer(int ID,
                    java.util.List<java.lang.String> value)
        This method will remove a packet from the Flowbuffer, when we see it come into a router
        Parameters:
        ID - - ID number of each packet
        value - - List {Router hostname, Router interfaceName}

      • getSize

        public static int getSize()
        This method checks the size of the FlowBuffer
        Returns:
        (int) the number of objects in the FlowBuffer

      • printBuffer

        public static void printBuffer()
        This method will print the buffer to the console in string format

      • getItem

        public static void getItem()
        This method will walk through the FlowBuffer and print out the current FlowBuffer contents

      • checkLoss

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> checkLoss()
        This method will check the loss of objects in the FlowBuffer **UNUSED at the moment
        Returns:
        - ArrayList of packets that were lost
